title: They shoot crocodiles...don't they?
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Kakadu National Park (N.T.)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Kakadu National Park (N.T.)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - Production and direction - Australia
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion picture producers and directors - Australia
description: This documentary provides the viewer with a fascinating insight into how wildlife documentaries are able to capture such spectacular footage. The film follows a year in the life of film makers Rory McGuinness, Rebecca Scott, their daughter Bella, and camera assistant Matt Cadwallader as they set out to film crocodiles, kangaroos and other creatures that inhabit Kakadu National Park. It is revealed as a process involving patience, persistence, nervous energy, and excitement.
